content.question: Two charged spheres, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, are held fixed at two vertices of a triangle, as shown above. The direction of the electric field <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the third vertex due to the two spheres is also shown. Which of the following correctly indicates the sign of the charges on the spheres?
